item.text:
Directs the Secretary of Defense to submit to the congressional defense and appropriations committees a detailed outline of, and accounting under the discretionary spending limit for: (1) the efficiencies relating to Department of Defense (DOD) contracting for goods and services, and (2) the DOD budget initiate.

Authorizes the Secretary to transfer amounts made available by a continuing resolution among DOD accounts. Prohibits the amount transferred to any account from exceeding that authorized for such account by the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013.

Makes such transfer authority inapplicable in the event a regular appropriations Act for DOD is enacted for FY2013.

Requires 15 days' advance notification to such committees prior to any such transfer.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.title: To grant the Secretary of Defense the authority to transfer funding under a continuing resolution, and for other purposes.
To grant the Secretary of Defense the authority to transfer funding under a continuing resolution, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Appropriations, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: To grant the Secretary of Defense the authority to transfer funding under a continuing resolution, and for other purposes.
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 159, Number 26 (Monday, February 25, 2013)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. HANABUSA:H.R. 810.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The constitutional authority on which this bill rests isthe power of Congress ``to provide for the common Defence'',``to raise and support Armies'', ``to provide and maintain aNavy'' and ``to make Rules for the Government and Regulationof the land and naval Forces'' as enumerated in Article I,section 8 of the United States Constitution.[Page H628]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
